alert.note: Alert for Allen; Beauregard; East Cameron; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 5:28AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CAMERON...JEFFERSON DAVIS...EASTERN BEAUREGARD...EASTERN CALCASIEU AND ALLEN PARISHES THROUGH 600 AM CST... At 528 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dry Creek to near Buller to near Cameron. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Jennings, Oakdale, Cameron, Westlake, Welsh, Iowa, Kinder, Basile, Oberlin, Elton, Fenton, Reeves, Grand Lake, Dry Creek, Hayes, Moss Bluff, Ragley, Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, and Lake Charles Regional Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 25 and 62. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Beauregard; East Cameron; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; West Cameron
